Ladhar Bheinn

Hear pronunciation Press to hear pronunciation

Deep in the wild Knoydart peninsula, Ladhar Bheinn usually requires an overnight stay. It is a truly magnificent mountain with a perfect position right on one of the most dramatic parts of the West Highlands seaboard. Dramatic ridges, multiple summits and an awesome corrie.

 You have not climbed Ladhar Bheinn.

Region: Fort William

Altitude: 1020 metres

Users' Rating:
  • Currently 4.47/5
Rating: 4.5/5 (64 votes cast)

You must be registered and signed-in to vote

Detailed route description and map

Ladhar Bheinn circuit via Aonach Sgoilite, from Inverie

Other routes and challenges

The circular route given above from Inverie - via the Aonach Sgoilte ridge - is nothing short of magnificent. However many regard the circuit of Coire Dhorchaill - from a start at Barrasdale Bay (wild camping) as the classic route on the mountain. Though shorter, this involves steep scrambling up to Stob a' Chearcaill.

Walker-friendly accommodation in the area

Invergarry & Knoydart Hotels

Invergarry & Knoydart B&B

Invergarry & Knoydart Cottages

Lochaber Hostels
